definitions.definition: A localized accumulation of pus in the skin, resulting from infection.
The point at which fluid begins to change to a vapour.
definitions.example: Add the noodles when the water comes to the boil.

definitions.definition: A dish of boiled food, especially based on seafood.
The collective noun for a group of hawks.
(of liquids) To heat to the point where it begins to turn into a gas.
definitions.example: Boil some water in a pan.
Boil the eggs for three minutes.

definitions.definition: (of liquids) To begin to turn into a gas, seethe.
definitions.example: Pure water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.

definitions.definition: To bring to a boil, to heat so as to cause the contents to boil.
(used only in progressive tenses, of weather) To be uncomfortably hot.
(used only in progressive tenses) To feel uncomfortably hot.
definitions.example: I’m boiling in here – could you open the window?

definitions.definition: To form, or separate, by boiling or evaporation.
To steep or soak in warm water.
To be agitated like boiling water; to bubble; to effervesce.
definitions.example: the boiling waves of the sea

definitions.definition: To be moved or excited with passion; to be hot or fervid.
